definition: to order goods/to place an order
to set/to fix/to determine/to decide/to order

sentences.english: I guess the ower of the call must order the song .
sentences.chinese: 当然可以猜到电话那边的主人一定是特意定购。

sentences.english: Martin telegraphed flowers to his girlfriend.
sentences.chinese: 马丁打电报定购鲜花送给女朋友。

sentences.english: What we can order from you right now are not cotton goods.
sentences.chinese: 目前咱们能向你定购的只有棉织品。

sentences.english: Order safety brushes for your escalator using EHC Global's online form.
sentences.chinese: 在线填写表格为您的扶梯定购安全刷。

sentences.english: The buyer then reviews the information and proceeds with the next ordering process.
sentences.chinese: 之后购买者将浏览信息并继续进行下个定购流程。

sentences.english: If you are prepared to increase the commi ion, we will order extra 3000 sets.
sentences.chinese: 如果你们增加佣金，我们将追加定购3000套。

sentences.english: They cancelled their order for the goods.
sentences.chinese: 他们取消了货物定购单。

sentences.english: He ordered the costumes from Japan at a cost of about US$200 each.
sentences.chinese: 他从日本定购服装，每套大约200美元。

sentences.english: D︰Wel amend the order and deliver the goods within this week.
sentences.chinese: 我们将更改那定购及在这个星期内送货。

sentences.english: The CAAC has ordered some new types of computers from Legend Company.
sentences.chinese: 中国民航向联想公司定购了一些新型电脑。

sentences.english: In addition, the movie channel secured two options to order batches of 10 more episodes.
sentences.chinese: 此外，电影频道获得了两个再批量定购10集的选择。

sentences.english: They immediately made a decision to order a 4-color shuttle pad printer from KCPM.
sentences.chinese: 客人当即签约定购四色穿梭移印机一台。

sentences.english: I'll ask the fishmonger if he can order three dozen oysters for me.
sentences.chinese: 我会问问那个卖鱼的，看看他能否给我定购3打牡蛎。

sentences.english: We start the service model by identifying the services that are involved in processing a purchase order.
sentences.chinese: 服务模型首先是识别处理定购单所涉及到的服务。

definition: variant of 訂貨|订货[ding4 huo4]
to order goods/to place an order
to procure (for an enterprise etc)/to purchase
variant of 訂單|订单[ding4 dan1]
to agree/to conclude/to draw up/to subscribe to (a newspaper etc)/to order
to have exclusive selling rights/to be the sole agent for a production unit or firm
